content.description:
This classic line traverses directly under the Brick Attack roof through five popular routes so be mindful of this if there are others in the area.  It can be done as a single pitch, but the drag would be awful.   

  Start around the corner to the left of Galaga and work your way up and right to the belay on the Galaga anchors.  Continue right on the delicate traverse below the impressive roof and end on Involuntary Manslaughter's anchors.
content.protection: SR, one fixed pin, bolted belays, and a few bolts to clip on the traverse

content.description: A great warm-up face climb. Begins with 2 very obvious large pockets.

Fun route with easy climbing and big exposure. 

  Begin with a large move boulder sequence (11a version), (stickclip the start) then cruise up the slab to a steep section with jugs. 

  Or negate the large move and traverse from the right into the headwall jugs

climbs.name: Sex Type Thing
climbs.fa: Ken Cuddy, Sean Burns, Adam Dick

content.description: 5 bolts. Very cool but seems overlooked in favor of the steeper routes in the area. A hard, thin start with a very reachy move leads to good 5.10 pocket climbing. Not a classic but not a bad route overall.
content.location: Dead vertical line of glue-ins on the wall that marks the east end of the Brick Attack area. It is the first bolted route to the left of the slab that contains flat fields and is on the section of rock to the right of Stick in Your Eye.

content.description:
A great precursor to "Brick Attack" 

  Go straight up the initial boulder problem 

  OR 

  Start as you would for "Slam Wow" then trend left up the steep head wall. 

  Make big moves on big holds. 

Big flake at the base of the steep headwall section has been reinforced with glue.
content.location: Route Immediately right of Brick Attack

content.description: A sporty start leads to nice jamming up higher.
content.location: Located on the wall right of Flying Elvis.

content.description: Pull through a low crux on decent holds. Ends before the roof.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor   There are lowering biners.

climbs.name: Flying Elvis
climbs.fa: Tony & Lori Mayse and Terry Andrews

content.description: Climbs steep jugs and slopers. One of the best lines in Arkansas.
content.location: Keep walking down the trail (away from the amphitheater) for a few hundred yards. After turn a corner and see a 60 foot 45 degree overhang shaped like an enormous triangle. The bolted like up this feature is Flying Elvis.

content.description:
Make some initial moves to get established onto the easy slab and cruise to the base of the roof. Collect your thoughts and thug your way out on massive handlebar jugs to the finish. 

  Arkansas classic, aesthetic and fun climbing.
content.protection: Fixed gear all throughout the route.
content.location: To the left of Flying Elvis, with the obvious roof.

content.description: This is the massive over-hanging crack that separates Flying Elvis and Involuntary Manslaughter.Â
content.protection: Large Camalots, Big Bros, and minimalist SR. Tree Anchor.
content.location: Obvious wide crack directly to the right of Flying Elvis. Left of Involuntary Manslaughter.

content.description:
The concentration of Cave Creeks most popular routes  

  Unique sandstone formations yield amazing climbing along this gorgeous wall.
